page.title: 16FARMING
page.content: Farming in the area is mainly arable and dairy although some farms are mixed.There are at least two poultry farms as well.The most common animals kept in the area are cattle. These are Friesian cows for milk and Hereford crosses for beef, although some continental breeds are being introduced for beef such as Charolais. The main crops are grass, cereals , particuarly barley ,and some potatoes. Most of the grass is turned into silage but some is made into hay. Common jobs a farmer does may include manure or slurry spreading, hay making, shed cleaning, milking, making silage and crop sowing and harvesting. Many farmers hire agricultural contractors to do jobs involving expensive machinery such as harvesting,hedge-cutting and ditching. {BY SIMON & KATE
